title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
description: Spaghetti Carbonara is a classic Roman pasta dish made with eggs, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper. The dish gets its name from carbonaro, the Italian word for charcoal burner, and is said to have been originally a meal for Italian charcoal workers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat a large pan over medium heat and cook pancetta until crispy (about 5-7 minutes).
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and a generous amount of black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Working quickly, add hot pasta to the pancetta pan, then remove from heat.
Pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing quickly to create a creamy sauce. Add pasta water as needed to achieve desired consistency.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper.
tips: Use guanciale instead of pancetta for authentic Roman flavor
Never add cream - authentic carbonara doesn't include it
Work quickly to prevent eggs from scrambling
Reserve pasta water - it helps create the creamy sauce

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
description: Chicken Tikka Masala is a popular Indian dish of roasted chicken chunks in a spiced curry sauce. It is believed to have originated in the UK, though inspired by traditional Indian cooking. The sauce is usually creamy, orange-coloured, and mildly spiced.
ingredients: 800g boneless chicken thighs, cut into cubes
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, 2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and half the spices for at least 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F) and bake chicken for 15-20 minutes until slightly charred.
Heat oil in a large pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add remaining ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes until oil separates.
Add remaining spices and cook for 2 more minutes.
Add baked chicken pieces and 1 cup water, simmer for 10 minutes.
Add cream and butter, simmer for 5 more minutes.
Crush kasuri methi between palms and add to curry.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with naan or rice.
tips: Marinate chicken overnight for best flavor
Use heavy cream for authentic creamy texture
Kasuri methi is essential - don't skip it
Char the chicken slightly for authentic tikka flavor

title: Vegetable Lasagna
summary: Layers of pasta, roasted vegetables, ricotta cheese, and marinara sauce.
description: A vegetarian take on the classic Italian lasagna, packed with roasted vegetables, three types of cheese, and rich marinara sauce. Perfect for family dinners and meal prep.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Toss vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 20-25 minutes.
Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions until al dente.
In a bowl, mix ricotta, 1 egg, half the parmesan, salt, and pepper.
Spread thin layer of marinara in 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer: 4 noodles, 1/3 ricotta mixture, 1/3 roasted vegetables, 1/3 marinara sauce.
Repeat layers twice more.
Top with mozzarella and remaining parmesan.
Cover with foil and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 30 minutes.
Remove foil and bake for 15 more minutes until golden and bubbly.
Let rest 15 minutes before serving, garnish with fresh basil.
tips: Let lasagna rest before cutting for clean slices
Use no-boil lasagna noodles to save time
Fresh basil at the end adds brightness
